snippet.title: Graphing the Cotangent Function
snippet.description:
Learn how to graph a cotangent function. To graph a cotangent function, we first determine the period (the distance/time for a complete oscillation), the phase shift (the horizontal shift from the parent function), the vertical shift (the vertical shift from the parent function) and the asymptotes (the two vertical lines which the graph does not touch). After we have obtained these features, we plot the points on the graph and graph accordingly.
